Key Match Events: Scotland reached 90-0 off 10 overs before the game was halted
Michael Jones hit a breathtaking six from the Durham right-hander, the ball soaring on to the roof of the Greenidge and Haynes Stand and smashing a solar panel
Jos Buttler’s men would have needed 109 from 10 overs to win; a challenging but not impossible target given their array of power-hitters
Pre-Game Insights: England’s head coach, Matthew Mott, said that they were a bit sloppy in the field, with a bit of nerves at the start of the tournament
Post-Match Reflections: Richie Berrington said that Scotland certainly gave themselves a chance, but the match was abandoned due to rain
England will need to be far sharper against Australia on Saturday than was witnessed here
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was abandoned due to rain, with Scotland reaching 90-0 off 10 overs
The match was reconfigured to 10 overs per side and a revised target for England
Scotland’s innings would first need to be completed with England two bowlers down, Wood and Archer having sent down their allocation by this point
Others: The match was delayed due to water leaking through the covers and on to the pitch
A couple of misfields in the ring and a wicket off a no-ball from Mark Wood enabled Scotland to reach 51 for no loss from the initial 6.2 overs
